hypothesis_content.title: ETH/BTC Ratio Decline Amplification on BTC Weakness Catalyst
hypothesis_content.statement: When a negative macro catalyst triggers a sharp BTC decline (>2% in 1 hour) in a NEUTRAL regime, the ETH/BTC ratio will decline by an additional 0.8-1.2% over the following 4 hours as risk-off flows disproportionately exit altcoin exposure, amplifying the relative BTC weakness.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During risk-off events triggered by systemic concerns, capital flees to the perceived 'safest' asset within crypto (BTC). This causes a rotation out of alts/ETH, exacerbating their underperformance. The recent parallel drop in BTC and ETH, with headlines focusing on BTC, supports this dynamic.
entry_conditions: BTC drops >2% within 1 hour on a identifiable catalyst (macro news, large liquidation cluster)
ETH/BTC ratio is above its 10-day moving average (indicating recent altcoin strength)
ETH/BTC ratio begins to drop within 30 minutes of BTC's initial decline

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH/BTC ratio declines by 1.0% from entry ratio level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio recovers to its pre-catalyst level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: During BTC sell-offs, ETH/BTC ratio remains stable or increases, indicating no rotational amplification or even a 'flight to quality' within alts.
